intro.text:
You must be the new student.
It's so nice to finally see you!

intro 2.text: I hope you didn't get lost finding this building...

intro 3.text:
I would have started my shift early if you did.
And I'm just not that kind of employee

intro 4.text:
Oh! And don't be shy to ask any questions.
Just raise your right hand.

intro 5.text:
You're also free to keep note of {certain words} I say.
Just tap to remember the keyword and raise your hand for further details
choices:
Nice to meet you too!
Who are you exactly?

who are you 2.text:
As you can see,
I take on many forms.
Animal companions are quite popular with the humans I hear.

who are you 3.text:
But my gods!
It is a pain to be coddled all the time.

who are you 4.text:
But my gods!
It is a pain to be coddled all the time.

who are you 5.text:
At times I just turn into the creature I become.
In both body and mind!

who are you 6.text: Regardless, I just hope you like what I've become for you.

I did not get lost..text:
Oh good!
 That's good to hear...

not lost 2.text: When you have guided so many over the millenia you start to wonder how many of them wanted to end up there in the first place!

not lost 3.text: So, I am happy that you seem to know what you want.

not lost 4.text: I, myself, have had a hard time figuring out what i wanted in my younger days.

What exactly IS your job?.text:
I am a guide.
What sort of guide you ask?
 Well, it depends!

what job 2.text: Depending on who you are, what you believe in, and your state of being, I can be the guide that one either seeks OR needs.

what job 3.text: In the case of this {digital realm} I am a teacher.

main.text:
I will be one of your guides here.
You have brought yourself to this place.
As you have chosen to take on a pursuit into your education!

main 2.text: A post-secondary education to be specific.

main 3.text: And this play space and your avatar in which you possess will be assets to prepare you for your journey into your post-secondary experience!
choices: What exactly will I be learning?
I don't think i have "chosen" anything just yet

learning 2.text: Not many adventurers question the quests they are given. Expectations are often led astray for the lack of such introspection.

learning 3.text: It costed those men and women plenty

learning 4.text: The things you will be learning are the necessary preparations and benefits that are designed to help neurodiverse students transition into their post-secondary education.

learning 5.text: Let me show you some of the buildings you will be entering soon... Each with their own experts.

counseling office 2.text: Here you will learn about your disability. To understand it and the stigma behind it. This is where you will properly start.

Lecture Hall 2.text: High School and Post-Secondary are hardly ever the same thing. Here you will learn exactly what those differences are.

Counselling Office 5.text: I believe that it is you that made the choice to head into post-secondary. Therefore, you must choose your field of study.
I believe that it is you that made the choice to head into post-secondary. Therefore, you must choose your field of study.

Counselling Office 6.text: (The Brave) will make those choices clear.

learning 6.text: We like to take things slow around here. So, many buildings will be kept a secret from you until you have triumphed the first one.

I don't think i have \"chosen\" anything.text:
This is valid and acceptable.
We hope by the end of this journey you will come to a choice.
 There are many things to figure out!
{Interests}, {Work Values}, {Traits}, and {Skills}.

chosen 3.text: Let's start figuring you out right now!

chosen 4.text: So what exactly are you trying to figure out?

choices.choice: What do I value in work?
I am unsure what my skills actually are
I'd like to know more about my work traits

What interests me..text: Very well, we can figure that out right.

interests 2.text:
In my younger years, there really wasn't much to do.
The sun had yet to form and no lives to interact with
so it took me a while to know what exactly interested me.

What do I value in work?.text: Very well, we can figure that out right now

value work 2.text:
Everyone is unique. Different.
Work is something to be done
out of necessity or passion.

value work 3.text:
The latter is the type of work all intelligent life strives for.
And to do that, one must understand themselves in what it is
That they value in terms of work.

I am unsure what my skills actually are.text: Very well we can figure it out

my skills 2.text:
Nobody is ever born knowing their purpose
nor the specific skills or physical ability it takes
toget to said purpose.

my skills 3.text:
But I am here to help
this may even change in the future!
and i look forward
to seeing you here again when that time comes.

I'd like to know more about my work trai.text:
I'm certain after a couple of questions
we'll be able to find something!

traits 2.text:
It's nice that we took this time to get to know you more!
You have the traits of (result)

move on.text:
I hope that my assessments helped you
understand yourself a little more to make a proper conclusion as to whether or not you want
to attend a post-secondary education.

main 5.text:
Let me guide you on growth and fixed {mindsets}
are you familiar with the concept?
choices: Yes, I have heard of this

have heard 2.text:
Then this is some sort of review then,
As this is essential to having a manageable post-secondary life.

mindsets.text:
The "mindset" is a term
Used to describe an individual's thoughts on their own
talents and abilities.

mindsets 2.text:
Carol Dweck, creator of the term,
states that there are two mindsets
that and individual possesses.
A {Fixed Mindset} and {Growth Mindset}.
choices: Which one do you think I am?

What are those?.text:
Fixed Mindsets involve the thought of the "innate" talent
where one's unique skills are to be born with
and not developed.

what are they 2.text:
This often leads into a lack of a drive for self-improvement
As the self-made argument presents the individual like this...

what are they 3.text: "Since talent is born you can't be better than how you are now"

what are they 4.text:
The Growth Mindset involves the thought of improvement.
Individuals with this mindset are not bound by innate limits.

what are they 6.text:
Growth Mindset individuals do not define them to be "limits"
but rather "potential"

what are they 7.text:
And thus, said potential can be cultivated and improved
through routine or practice.

what are they 8.text:
I, myself, was never the guide that I am today
without this mindset.

what are they 9.text:
Given immortality like me,
you'll eventually want to.

what are they 10.text: But it all starts with a choice on wanting to improve.

want to improve 2.text:
And the first step to this would be
to understand the "{Spirals}"

want to improve 3.text:
No, it is not a strong source of energy
from some work of fiction.

want to improve 4.text:
It refers to the workflow of how one approaches
challenges and tasks.

want to improve 5.text: When given a challenge, how do you approach it?
choices: I struggle quite greatly with the given task
I keep going until I lose success

I struggle quite greatly with the given.text:
And i assume the more you struggle with said task
the more you find yourself in doubt and criticism?
which in term leads to GREATER doubt
and HARSHER criticisms in your own work.

struggle 2.text:
And in the end, you find yourself avoiding said challenge
as it swallows you whole in a cycle of frustration.

struggle 3.text:
This is known as a
"Struggle Spiral"

choices.choice: I keep going until I lose success

I keep going until I lose success.text:
Although it is good to succeed at the task
over and over again.

success 2.text:
We fuel our motivation as long as success is met.
Sometimes leading us into more challenges and into new activities.

success 4.text:
The streak is lost and the motivation is gone
your very foundations of improvement are crumbled
all because you had one instance of failure.

success 5.text:
This is what's known as the
"Success Spiral"

choices.choice: I struggle quite greatly with the given task

spirals.text:
Both spirals showcase how we can easily fall victim
to a mindset that can greatly reduce in productivity
which will hinder you from thriving in
a post-secondary environment.
choices: Then what does it take to improve?
Seriously, do i have to be immortal?

Then what does it take to improve?.text:
Well, there are multiple things to consider...
Though it may not be the exact solutions
These are simply thoughts for guidance.

what it takes 4.text: The process of learning something new is not linear.

what it takes 5.text:
Experimenting on new ideas is a part of the learning process
when approaching such material, it is important to adopt
and approach as you gather info, process, and strategize
your way through the challenges that comes with ADHD and LD.

what it takes 6.text:
The key is to remind yourself that experimentation
is all a part of the learning process.

what it takes 7.text:
Failure is necessary
to bring you closer to your goal.
 A malleable yellow dog once told me that.

what it takes 9.text:
When trying new things, sometimes said thing
looks deceptively simple and that it is a challenge to implement

what it takes 10.text:
And with certain strategies of approach being quite popular.
I would understand why one were to get frustrated
when the popular strategy is done with difficulty
while everyone else seems to do it with ease.

what it takes 11.text:
Remember that experimentation is all a part of the process
with each failure, or success, it will always bring you closer
to your goals.

what it takes 12.text:
It is hardly a waste of time as what does NOT work
helps you on what works and what does not work

what it takes 13.text: "Past Performance Does Not Equal Future Performance"

what it takes 14.text: Your past should never define you

what it takes 15.text:
Though you may fail to the point of giving up,
those past mistakes are meant to be learnt from
and so you must move on.

what it takes 16.text: Consider learning these to work towards your future goals...

what it takes 18.text:
...Bounce back from failure
and user the experience to course correct...

what it takes 19.text:
...address your challenges,
including ADHD and Learning Disabilities,
to make your life easier...

what it takes 20.text: ...access the resources you need to chart a new course

what it takes 21.text:
There is always something to learn.
NO matter the failures.

what it takes 23.text:
After experimenting what does and does not work,
it is best to be kind to yourself and show yourself
that no progress is truly linear and struggle is natural

Seriously, do i have to be immortal?.text:
No
No, you don't
as limited human life is compared to mine.

immortal 2.text:
Your own life is long enough and worth spending
as much time to think about what exactly it is
you find to be the best route for you to grow
and this journey is meant for you to realize that you can grow.
Not to be fixed unto one spot.

conclusion.text:
When you can approach your learning with curiosity
your chances of success will increase
and will help motivate you to figure out
the best path forward for you

conclusion 2.text: I welcome you to this journey.
